  • Constructor Details

    • MazeFactoryTest

      public MazeFactoryTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public static void setUp()
      Create 10 mazes of varying difficulty for ease of testing. This makes it so tests don't have to remake mazes multiple times. Do not do skill levels a-f because it would be too expensive to create them.

    • testOrderDFS

      public final void testOrderDFS()
      Test Case: Check if something gets built by the factory. Routine being tested: order Can test routine by creating an order for a maze, and seeing if something is outputted. Not checking if it is a true maze yet, only if the factory builds something. This method checks if something gets built using default parameters.

    • testOrderPrim

      public final void testOrderPrim()
      Test Case: Check if something gets built by the factory. Routine being tested: order Can test routine by creating an order for a maze, and seeing if something is outputted. Not checking if it is a true maze yet, only if the factory builds something. This method checks if something gets built using Prim parameters.

    • testOrderBoruvka

      public final void testOrderBoruvka()
      Test Case: Check if something gets built by the factory. Routine being tested: order Can test routine by creating an order for a maze, and seeing if something is outputted. Not checking if it is a true maze yet, only if the factory builds something. This method checks if something gets built using Boruvka parameters.

    • testOrderEller

      public final void testOrderEller()
      Test Case: Check if something does not get built by the factory. Routine being tested: order Can test routine by creating an order for a maze, and seeing if something is outputted. Not checking if it is a true maze yet, only making sure the factory does not build something. This method checks to make sure that Eller's generation algorithm wasn't accidentally implemented.

    • testOrderKruskal

      public final void testOrderKruskal()
      Test Case: Check if something does not get built by the factory. Routine being tested: order Can test routine by creating an order for a maze, and seeing if something is outputted. Not checking if it is a true maze yet, only making sure the factory does not build something. This method checks to make sure that Kruskal's generation algorithm wasn't accidentally implemented.

    • testHasExitAttribute

      public void testHasExitAttribute()
      Test Case: Check if exit is saved in maze Routine being tested: order Can test routine by simply seeing if exit attribute has been saved.

    • testHasStartAttribute

      public void testHasStartAttribute()
      Test Case: Check if start is saved in maze Routine being tested: order Can test routine by simply seeing if starting attribute has been saved.

    • testHasExit

      public void testHasExit()
      Test Case: Check if maze has an exit cell Routine being tested: generate After creating a maze, simply go to check if the floor plan that should have been made has an exit somewhere within the maze. Goes around border of the maze until it finds an opening to the exterior of the maze, meaning there is no wallboard present.

    • testHasOnlyOneExit

      public void testHasOnlyOneExit()
      Test Case: Check if maze has only one exit cell Routine being tested: generate After creating a maze, make sure the floorplan only has one opening to the exterior of the maze, and no more. Goes around border of the maze trying to find an opening to the exterior of the maze, meaning there is no wallboard present. Counts how many times it succeeds, and passes if only once, fails if more.

    • testAllHaveDistance

      public void testAllHaveDistance()
      Test Case: Check if maze has only one exit cell Routine being tested: generate After creating a maze, makes sure that all cells have a distance from the exit, meaning that they are all reachable in some way. Can use this by checking the dists attribute in MazeFactory's builder attribute.

    • testExitIsMinimal

      public void testExitIsMinimal()
      Test Case: Check that exit's distance is minimal Routine being tested: generate After a maze has been created, check that the distance at the end is the smallest value, since it should be closest to the end of the maze.

    • testStartIsMaximal

      public void testStartIsMaximal()
      Test Case: Check that starting distance is maximal Routine being tested: generate After a maze has been created, check that the distance at the beginning was chosen because it was the farthest from the end of the maze.

    • testPerfectMazeNoRooms

      public void testPerfectMazeNoRooms()
      Test Case: Check if perfect maze has illegal cells Routine being tested: order Tests if there is a large enough block of cells that do not have wallboards, making a room when the maze should not have any.

    • testInternalWallCount

      public void testInternalWallCount()
      Test Case: Check if a perfect maze has correct number of walls Routine being tested: generate Tests if the maze has the current number of internal walls.
